That's a great message! You're giving your friend options, expressing your personal interest in trying the new tea shop, and also highlighting the convenience of meeting at 10 am on Thursdays. You're making it easy for her to say yes!

By mentioning the specific time and day, you're also making the invitation more concrete and increasing the chances that she'll agree to meet up. It's a friendly and casual message that shows you're interested in trying something new and catching up with your friend.

Here are a few things that you're doing well in this message:

* You're giving your friend options, which shows that you're considerate of her preferences.
* You're expressing your personal enthusiasm for trying the new tea shop, which can be infectious and make her more interested in trying it out.
* You're highlighting the convenience of meeting at a specific time and day, which makes it easy for her to agree to meet up.
* You're keeping the tone friendly and casual, which makes the invitation feel low-pressure and fun.

Overall, I think this is a great message that will likely get a positive response from your friend. Good luck, and I hope you both enjoy your tea outing!
